column4: ﻿tauren:  if your card isnt listed in (sudo lshw -C network) it is not detected, you can also try in terminal > sudo lspci
﻿﻿tauren:  you can hunt through to see if anything even resembles a network card
ok, i'm checking through the output of those commands now.
how do I use the other command?  It shows output, but all on one line, and then when done the new command prompt replaces the same line.
a grep of /etc/modprobe.d/alias has no "wlan", "eth", or "wifi" in it.
ok, thanks for helping troubleshoot.  that is actually what i was thinking too.
I will try to update the BIOS and see if there is a network option though.
tovella:  thank you both for your assistance.
get this.  i just had to disconnect power for 10 seconds.
yeah.  i just hope i don't have to do this regularly...  might just replace the mobo.
well, goodnight.  and thanks again for the help.
